reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Senacki is well located on a street connecting the main square and the royal palace. All the sights are within walking distance the furthest being Schindlers Museum but even this is only a one hour stroll along the beautiful riverside. The street is a little busy during the day with pedestrians but there is not much traffic. The hotel also has very effective double glazing. The hotel itself is fairly small but has two restaurants, one in the basement (lift available) which is also used for breakfast and one near the entrance. There is no bar in the hotel but there are numerous bars nearby.
reviews.title: Great hotel with perfect location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled with friends
reviews.text: We were upgraded to a suite which was excellent. The rooms were spacious, very clean and equipped with toiletries etc and the mini bar was surprisingly reasonably priced, midway between bar and supermarket prices. The furnishings were traditional in dark wood but fitted the ambience very well. The hotel staff were really helpful and curteous.
reviews.title: Outstanding Location in a Wonderful City

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast was excellent with a cold buffet offering cereals. fruit juices,cheese ,meats etc and there was also a hot breakfast available i.e. eggs, bacon, sausages pancakes etc. Beware that you have to ask for the hot breakfast if you want it, they do not ask you!!
reviews.title: very Good All Round

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There are plenty of really good, reasonably priced ,restaurants nearby but the main square is very expensive and from our experience the food and service is poor. Try a Mexican for a cheap meal and cheap wine. Generally service everywhere is very slow but this appears to be the Polish way so just relax as the food is good. Wine is very expensive but lager cheaper than at home. There is a little supermarket near the hotel and drinks from here were very cheap- so stock your mini bar with your nightcaps!!
reviews.title: The best things come in small packages.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Polish dumplings and pancakes are great if you have a sweet tooth!!
reviews.title: Great place to stay whilst visiting Krakow

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel is amazing! Our visit to Krakow began with us arriving very late to the Hotel Senacki. We were greeted by a very relieved staff member (Sylwia) who had been expecting us. She really made us feel at home. She gave us maps, information on trips we could take and even restaurant recommendations. The airline had lost our luggage so the staff at Hotel Senacki made numerous calls on our behalf trying to get any information they could about where the bags were and when we could expect them. Can't really tell you how much that meant to us. Thanks!
reviews.title: Amazing service + hotel = Hotel Senacki!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled on business
reviews.text: The location of the hotel is great, close (5 minute walk) to the main square, and to the Wawel. Our room was very spacious. It had an entryway with mini fridge, sitting room, bedroom (with dressing table) and large bathroom. We were facing the main street and did not find it too loud at all, even slept with the window open (and I am a very light sleeper). The room was spotless and comfortable. Breakfast was awesome! There was great selection in the buffet: sausages, yogurt, cereals, cheese, meat, breads, eggs, etc. You can also order something made fresh from the menus on the table. I HIGHLY recommend having the nalesniki z serem (crepes with sweetened cream), I didn't come across better nalesniki anywhere else in Poland (we travelled all over for 2 weeks)! Breakfast is downstairs in the beautiful cellars.
reviews.title: Great butique hotel!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Free wi-fi in the rooms too.
reviews.title: Great little hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled with friends
reviews.text: I have nothing but great things to say about this hotel. The staff is superb! The next time we are in Krakow we will be staying at Hotel Senacki!
reviews.title: Great location, Helpful staff , Great breakfast

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011
reviews.text: This is a very well located hotel! The rooms are a good size, elegantly designed and furnished, the breakfast excellent and the staff extremely helpful. I would recommend it highly.
reviews.title: Great value and perfect location!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: You cannot get a better location than the Senacki. This is a small boutique hotel that includes a wonderfull breakfast with the room. The staff at the front desk were very patient and gave us good advice about tours and restaurants. I would recommend this place to everyone. Walk everywhere. We had a ball in Krakow.
reviews.title: Great location in the center of everything!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled solo
reviews.text: Stayed at the Hotel in late January 2011. Exceptional value for money (£43 a night for a single) given how close the hotel is to the centre of town (some 500m to the main square). The room I had was clean and well presented, reception staff helpful. Breakfast was hearty and available in the restaurant in the basement.
reviews.title: Great value and location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: As a simple no-frill base to explore Cracow you can’t go wrong. I used the hotel as a base to go on the Free Walking Tour of Cracow, as well as visit Auschwitz Camp and the Salt Mine Tour.
reviews.title: in the very center of the old city, clean, great breakfast, spacy rooms!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled with friends
reviews.text: The Hotel is located on the main street (Grodzka str) connecting the two most interesting sights of the untouched historic center: the Market Square (Rynek) and the Wawel Castle. You dive in the mideaval atmosphere any time you step out into the intriguing city!
reviews.title: Great location, good value for money

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011
reviews.text: Although I think some of the reviews of this hotel are a bit too much on the positive side, I must say we were really satisfied with our stay. Our rooms were nice and spacious, and they were nice and clean, although the beds were really hard and uncomfortable. However, our room was facing the main street, and there was significant noice from the street during the night from (drunk) people passing to and from the market square. Staff was very positive and helpful, and breakfast was OK, although the selection was somewhat limited. On the plus side, you could order additional hot dishes from a menu and also delicious coffees from the barista there, all included in the rate of breakfast.
reviews.title: Wonderful hotel in superb location. Very friendly & helpful.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed for 3 days at the Hotel Senacki and had a truly wonderful stay. The receptionists were extremely helpful with bookings and information. We had a suite and it was so very nice. Breakfast was also great, eggs, pancakes etc. is made to order and to your liking and is included in the price. If we come back to Krakow we are staying here - no question.
reviews.title: Wonderful hotel with excellent service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: We recommend Hotel Senacki with pleasure.
reviews.title: Exellent

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Spotlessly clean. Warm spacious bedroom with tea/coffee tray. Good clean and bright bathroom. Super breakfast served in the lovely old cellar, with cooked meals on request.
reviews.title: excellent value for money

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: All the staff were very helpful and friendly. We booked trips and taxi's at reception, nothing was a problem. This hotel would be our first choice on a return to Krakow.
reviews.title: Great hotel for a great price

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled with friends
reviews.text: great location, 20 minute walk from the railway station and we walked everywhere, good size room and facilities, great breakfast selection, freindly and helpful staff who arranged for a bottle of champagne in our room for our wedding anniversary.
reviews.title: Lovely place great location, pity room was not bigger
